1120327300036333569.text: 0/ $BTC trailing 7D realized vol is in the bottom ~20% of observed periods. Realized returns over the trailing ~1-10D period are in the ~50% range of observed periods.pic.twitter.com/vRMq3dTg3i

1115252900077428736.text: 4/ Looking at local highs there's been a divergent path (pre and post August of '18). Pre August '18 it was a predictive indicator of future outperformance (reflexivity of the asset class) post August of '18 it led to subsequent underperformance (as positioning was more relevant)pic.twitter.com/Fi8gHOMteT

1120667723292389376.text: 3/ Given the elevated volumes we've seen coupled with broader market positioning the market seems to have as much momentum as there's been since Fall of '17 with this broader set up.

1115219461903138816.text: 2/ Bitmex continues to show fairly balanced demand for $BTC with the daily funding rate in the ~55% of observed periods isolating on both sides of 0.0%pic.twitter.com/X7m19plFfI

1120327302783602688.text: 2/ Bitmex $BTC funding continues to oscillate around 0.0% and right now stands at ~50% range of observed periods.pic.twitter.com/tQZ5UIBoWz

1122847633712852992.text: 2/ Since the NYAG report came out last Thursday $BTC has traded significant volume all at levels higher than where spot prices were ~1.5 weeks before the report. This is in stark contrast to last Fall where headlines preceded the technical break of $6K and YTD lows.

1121423467872686080.text: Another case of "DeFi" realizing it can't work without having the appropriate regulatory construct. What do the $MKR bulls think about their desire to buy a B/D and try to apply for an ATS (hint they won't get approved) @spencernoon @panekkkkhttps://www.theblockcrypto.com/2019/04/25/inside-maker-dao-leadership-conflict-over-direction-fuels-multiple-departures-as-it-eyes-launch-of-ats/ …

1122847634425823232.text: 3/ This difference is largely reflected in the different sentiment in the market place. In bear markets; prices don’t react to good news; in bull markets; prices shrug off bad news.

1122866705888415749.text: 5/ Looking at bottom 20% $BTC L/S ratio & Bitmex funding rate has largely led to periods of outperformance over the subsequent 10-20D period (outside Nov '18 after we had already broken $6K support and BCH /BSV debacle) and Sept '17 (China Ban / Jamie Dimon)pic.twitter.com/MKK2fFDgiz

1122847635122028544.text: 4/ It’s not to say we’re out of the woods yet. The E*Trade headline over the weekend and TD Ameritrade headlines last week would’ve been +10%+ events in 2017 (which also wasn’t healthy). All together it looks like we continue to be in a favorable trading market ($3200-$6K)

1120667720016650242.text: 1/ The last time funding rate was negative & the L/S ratio was <1.0 was also 1/3. This has happened ~17% of the time since the L/S ratio data was made available (but this is only the third time this year). Forward $BTC performance is mixed largely dependent upon spot trends:pic.twitter.com/OTVrukW2wB

1120327304658530306.text: 3/ This consolidation has occurred on healthy volumes although $BTC has stalled in the $5300-$5400 range with some alts that led the advancement e.g.,  $LTC and $BCH withdrawing 20% / 15% respectively off their recent highs.

1120327301072400387.text: 1/ This has coincided with a retreat in the Bitfinex $BTC L/S ratio to the lowest level since 3/19 and a combination of the highest spot price with lowest ratio since 11/15.pic.twitter.com/wQyMJGufGW

1115219461345300480.text: 1/ The big caveat here is @bitfinex waning importance. Outright longs are in their ~40% while the L/S ratio is in the upper 80% as volume continues to move away from Bitfinex towards @BitMEXdotcom

1120667718900961280.text: 0/ $BTC's funding rate on Bitmex turned negative this AM as shorts look to pile on at YTD highs.  This has occurred with the L/S ratio <1.0 at the lowest level since 1/3 (BTC was $3800).pic.twitter.com/Xt0nf8mKEf

1120327305690320897.text: 4/ Positioning is as clean as it's been for $BTC at a local high in months and the broader consolidation should be viewed as a healthy replacement of weak hands into stronger hands.

1122847630424453120.text: 0/ The $BTC Bitfinex L/S ratio is in the bottom 1% of observed periods at levels only seen last October when there were Bitfinex / Tether issues resulting in elevated perceived counterparty risk. Notably despite the headlines outright short interest continues to increase.pic.twitter.com/JQDHdqmi1R

1122847632236404736.text: 1/ In October the Bitmex funding rate remained positive suggesting this was isolated to Bitfinex counterparty risk as opposed to broader $BTC positioning. This time the Bitmex funding rate has been negative for 7 consecutive days and is in the bottom ~20% of observed periods.pic.twitter.com/cX7xZVaLVu

1115252898793951232.text: 3/ If we look at the $ETH L/S ratio it's made a series of all time highs now in the top 0.5% of observed periods. The outright levels are also at all time highs which makes it more relevant as well.pic.twitter.com/zI0fSXr8Zu

1120667721816051712.text: 2/ Looking at the outliers the strongest periods of $BTC outperformance occurred in Sept of ’17 (+50%), Nov ’17 (+70%) and April of ’18  ((+30%) when this occurred last time. These conditions were also present late Nov post breaking YTD support seeing another ~25% sell off.pic.twitter.com/Zmrc0zDmoK
